name: Charlemagne
role: King of the Franks & Holy Roman Emperor
achievements: United most of Western Europe for the first time since the Roman Empire. Promoted education and literacy through the Carolingian Renaissance.
legacy: Father of Europe. His empire laid the foundations for both France and Germany. His educational reforms preserved classical learning.
quote: Right action is better than knowledge; but in order to do what is right, we must know what is right.
fun-desc: He could speak Latin and Greek but never learned to write. He kept tablets under his pillow to practice at night.

name: Joan of Arc
achievements: Led French forces to victory at Orléans during the Hundred Years' War. Instrumental in crowning Charles VII as King.
legacy: Symbol of French unity and nationalism. Canonized as a saint in 1920. Inspired countless works of art and literature.
quote: I am not afraid; I was born to do this.
fun-desc: She was only 17 when she convinced the Dauphin to give her command of an army. She dictated letters since she couldn't read or write.

name: Louis XIV
achievements: Longest reign in European history (72 years). Built Versailles. Made France the dominant power in Europe. Patron of arts and culture.
legacy: Established absolute monarchy as a model. French became the language of diplomacy. His court set European cultural standards.
quote: L'État, c'est moi (I am the State).
fun-desc: He was only 4 when he became king. He loved ballet and performed 80 roles in 40 ballets, including as Apollo the Sun God.

name: Napoleon Bonaparte
achievements: Conquered most of Europe. Established the Napoleonic Code which influenced legal systems worldwide. Modernized French administration.
legacy: Spread ideals of the French Revolution across Europe. The Napoleonic Code remains the basis of civil law in many countries.
quote: Impossible is a word to be found only in the dictionary of fools.
fun-desc: He wasn't actually short - at 5'7" he was average height. The myth came from British propaganda and different measurement systems.

name: Charles de Gaulle
achievements: Led Free French Forces during WWII. Founded the Fifth Republic. Ended the Algerian War. Withdrew France from NATO command.
legacy: Restored French prestige after WWII. His vision of an independent France shaped modern French foreign policy.
quote: France has no friends, only interests.
fun-desc: At 6'5" he was so tall that armored cars had to be modified for him. He survived over 30 assassination attempts.

name: Cardinal Richelieu
achievements: Centralized royal power. Weakened the nobility. Founded the Académie française. Made France the dominant European power.
legacy: Created the modern concept of the nation-state. His policies laid groundwork for absolute monarchy under Louis XIV.
quote: If you give me six lines written by the hand of the most honest of men, I will find something in them which will hang him.
fun-desc: He kept 17 cats as pets and wrote plays in his spare time. He also created the first daily newspaper in France.

name: Henri IV
achievements: Ended the Wars of Religion with the Edict of Nantes. Rebuilt Paris. Improved infrastructure and agriculture.
legacy: Remembered as 'Good King Henry.' His religious tolerance was revolutionary for the time. Paris owes much of its beauty to him.
quote: Paris is well worth a Mass.
fun-desc: He converted to Catholicism to gain the throne but protected Protestant rights. He was assassinated by a Catholic fanatic.

name: Jean-Baptiste Colbert
role: Minister of Finance under Louis XIV
achievements: Created mercantilism as economic policy. Built the French navy. Established manufacturing standards. Reformed taxation.
legacy: Made France an economic powerhouse. Created the Gobelins tapestry factory and supported the arts.
quote: The art of taxation consists in so plucking the goose as to obtain the largest amount of feathers with the least amount of hissing.
fun-desc: He worked 16-hour days and demanded the same from his staff. He created the first effective French customs service.

name: Marie Curie
achievements: First woman to win a Nobel Prize. Only person to win Nobels in two different sciences. Discovered polonium and radium.
legacy: Pioneered research in radioactivity. Her work led to cancer treatment and nuclear energy. Opened doors for women in science.
quote: Nothing in life is to be feared, it is only to be understood.
fun-desc: Her papers are still radioactive and kept in lead-lined boxes. You need protective gear to view them.

name: Georges Clemenceau
achievements: Led France to victory in WWI. Fought for harsh terms against Germany at Versailles. Defended Dreyfus.
legacy: Saved France in its darkest hour. His fierce determination inspired the nation. Controversial legacy due to Versailles Treaty.
quote: War is too important to be left to the generals.
fun-desc: He fought a duel with a political rival at age 72. He was shot twice in assassination attempts and survived both.

name: Simone Veil
achievements: First woman President of European Parliament. Legalized abortion in France (Veil Law). Fought for women's rights and European unity.
legacy: Icon of women's rights in France. First woman buried in the Panthéon for her own achievements.
quote: We will never forget what we have seen.
fun-desc: She survived Auschwitz and Bergen-Belsen. Her camp number was tattooed on her arm, which she never hid.

name: Arthur Mensch
achievements: Co-founded Mistral AI; prominent voice in Europe’s AI ecosystem and debates on open models and tech sovereignty.
legacy: Represents a new wave of European deep-tech leadership balancing innovation, openness, and geopolitical reality.
fun-desc: A rare hybrid: serious research background + CEO operator energy in a very fast-moving field.

name: Clément Delangue
achievements: Built a major open-source and community platform for AI models, datasets, and tools; advocates for transparent, accessible AI.
legacy: A flagship example of “ecosystem leadership”: growing capability through open communities, not just closed products.
fun-desc: Often frames AI progress as a community project, not a winner-takes-all race.

name: Xavier Niel
achievements: Disrupted French telecom with low-cost offers and new infrastructure; major investor in tech and entrepreneurship.
legacy: Embodies ‘challenger strategy’ plus ecosystem building: access, education, capital, and platforms.
fun-desc: Known for contrarian plays and pushing markets to lower prices through aggressive competition.

name: Esther Duflo
achievements: Co-led the experimental approach (RCTs) to poverty alleviation research; Nobel Prize in Economic Sciences (2019).
legacy: Made evidence-based policy feel operational: test, measure, iterate (very Shizenkan-friendly).
fun-desc: Her work popularized the idea that social policy can be evaluated like engineering: hypotheses and experiments.

name: Jean-Marc Jancovici
role: Energy & Climate Expert (Co-founder, Carbone 4; Founder, The Shift Project)
achievements: Influential communicator on energy constraints and decarbonization; helped shape French carbon accounting methods and policy debates.
legacy: A central figure of the ‘energy realism’ school in France: linking physics, economy, and policy in one model.
fun-desc: If Shizenkan had a ‘CLD mascot’ for energy transition, he’d be a strong candidate.

name: Julie Chapon
achievements: Co-founded Yuka (launched 2017), scaling consumer transparency around food/cosmetics to tens of millions of users.
legacy: Shows how information design + behavior nudges can create mass-market health impact.
fun-desc: A simple scan became a system: users, brands, regulation pressure, and health awareness reinforcing each other.

name: Camille Étienne
achievements: Prominent voice of the ‘génération climat’, combining advocacy, civil disobedience, and public persuasion.
legacy: Represents the leadership style of the 2020s: narrative power, coalition building, and pressure on institutions.
fun-desc: More strategist than ‘influencer’: her work is about moving institutions, not just opinions.

name: Philippe de Villiers
role: Entrepreneur & Cultural Builder (Founder, Puy du Fou)
achievements: Created the Cinéscénie (1978) and founded Puy du Fou, building one of France’s best-known immersive history parks.
legacy: A case study in narrative leadership: culture + operations + volunteer ecosystem turned into a global-scale experience brand.
fun-desc: He started from a ruined château and turned it into a full-blown ‘history engine’ powered by storytelling and logistics.

name: Éric Larchevêque
achievements: Co-founded Ledger (2014) and helped build the ‘self-custody’ hardware wallet category; co-founded Coinhouse (La Maison du Bitcoin).
legacy: Leadership in trust infrastructure: security, product, and risk management in a frontier industry.
fun-desc: His core theme is sovereignty-through-tech: making individuals and organizations less dependent on fragile intermediaries.

name: Yann LeCun
role: AI Scientist & Tech Leader (Turing Award laureate; Founder, AMI/Advanced Machine Intelligence startup)
achievements: Turing Award (2018) for deep learning breakthroughs; announced departure from Meta to launch a new AI startup focused on ‘Advanced Machine Intelligence’.
legacy: Set the direction of modern AI research and pushed for open science and long-horizon ‘world-model’ approaches.
fun-desc: A classic Shizenkan profile: vision-first leader who thinks in systems, constraints, and second-order effects rather than hype cycles.

name: Octave Klaba
achievements: Founded OVH in 1999 and grew it into a major European cloud/infrastructure player (OVHcloud).
legacy: Industrial-scale execution in tech infrastructure: cost discipline, sovereignty, and platform resilience as strategy.
fun-desc: Built a ‘cloud factory’ mindset: infrastructure as a product, not a side-effect.

name: Valérie Masson-Delmotte
role: Climate Scientist (IPCC Working Group I Co-Chair, AR6 cycle)
achievements: Co-chaired IPCC Working Group I (physical science basis of climate change) for the Sixth Assessment cycle.
legacy: Evidence-based leadership under uncertainty: turning complex climate science into decision-relevant knowledge for society.
fun-desc: Her leadership lives in the space where ‘confidence intervals’ meet real-world policy deadlines.

name: Emmanuelle Charpentier
achievements: Co-awarded the Nobel Prize in Chemistry (2020) for CRISPR-Cas9 genome editing (‘genetic scissors’).
legacy: A defining modern science leader: breakthrough discovery with huge ethical, medical, and societal implications.
fun-desc: CRISPR is basically a new ‘edit button’ for biology, and she helped write the first clean UI.

name: Cédric Villani
achievements: Won the Fields Medal (2010) for work in mathematical physics and related areas; known for science communication.
legacy: Makes advanced ideas socially legible, bridging rigorous thinking with public discourse and education.
fun-desc: Proofs, politics, and poetry in the same coat: he treats ideas like living organisms.

name: Philippe Starck
achievements: Global body of work across products, interiors, and architecture; iconic ‘democratic design’ philosophy.
legacy: Design as leverage: reducing materials while maximizing meaning, usability, and cultural impact.
fun-desc: He treats everyday objects like strategy documents: if the form is wrong, the behavior is wrong.

name: Roxanne Varza
achievements: Leads Station F, one of Europe’s best-known startup campuses; connects founders, capital, and institutions at scale.
legacy: Ecosystem leadership: turning ‘many small bets’ into an innovation flywheel for a whole country/region.
fun-desc: Her superpower is orchestration: getting thousands of ambitious humans to move like an ecosystem, not a crowd.

name: Jean Dujardin
achievements: Won the Academy Award for Best Actor for The Artist (2011); became a major figure of modern French popular cinema.
legacy: A bridge between French comedy roots and global auteur cinema: proof that local stardom can scale worldwide without losing its accent.
quote: I don't want everyone to like me, and I don't choose who likes me. You have to give them the choice, give them the option.
fun-desc: He can switch from goofy swagger to silent-film elegance like he’s changing hats backstage in one breath.

name: Jean-Philippe Rameau
achievements: Re-shaped French opera and harmony theory; wrote landmark works for the stage and for keyboard.
legacy: Architect of sound: he didn’t just write music, he wrote the rules of the room where music happens.
quote: Music is a science which should have definite rules; these rules should be drawn from an evident principle; and this principle cannot really be known to us without the aid of mathematics.
fun-desc: If harmony had a chess grandmaster era, Rameau would be moving pieces three turns ahead, smiling politely.

name: Jérôme Le Banner
achievements: One of the most recognizable heavyweight figures of K-1 era fighting; known for power and durability in elite circuits.
legacy: A mythos of toughness: the kind of athlete who turns violence into spectacle and willpower into branding.
quote: I got only two words for Tim Sylvia: Anywhere, anytime!
fun-desc: He fights like a storm with a passport: wherever he goes, the atmosphere changes.

name: Sébastien Le Prestre de Vauban
role: Military Engineer (Louis XIV) | Marshal of France
achievements: Revolutionized siegecraft and fortress design; created a defensive system that influenced Europe for generations.
legacy: Engineering as statecraft: walls, angles, and logistics as a language of national survival.
quote: Seriously, Monseigneur, the king should think a little about making his 'own garden'
fun-desc: He looked at landscapes the way poets look at sunsets, except his poems were made of bastions and geometry.

name: Jules Brunet
role: French Military Officer (Boshin War adviser in Japan)
achievements: Served the Tokugawa side during the Boshin War; became a famed foreign officer linked to the Ezo episode.
legacy: A symbol of “professional loyalty vs. political tides”: the soldier who followed a cause to the edge of history.
quote: I have the honor of presenting to you my resignation from the rank of captain; I declare that from this 4 October 1868, I renounce the prerogatives of the position of artillery officer in the French army.
fun-desc: The kind of person who reads a recall order and replies, calmly: “Non.”

name: André Citroën
achievements: Built a landmark automotive company and pioneered modern mass-production and marketing in France.
legacy: Industrial imagination: turning engineering into everyday life, and factories into national momentum.
quote: As long as an idea is good, the price doesn’t matter.
fun-desc: He didn’t sell cars, he sold the future in metal form, with a logo you could spot from a kilometer away.

name: Abbé Pierre (Henri Grouès)
achievements: Founded the Emmaüs movement (1949) and became a major voice for the homeless and the poor in France.
legacy: Moral urgency in public life: the priest who turned compassion into a nationwide call to action.
quote: We are never happy except in the happiness we give. To give is to receive.
fun-desc: He could turn a cold street corner into a political question that nobody could ignore anymore.

name: Pierre de Coubertin
role: Educator & Reformer (Reviver of the Modern Olympic Games)
achievements: Co-founded the IOC and drove the revival of the Olympic Games, beginning with Athens 1896.
legacy: Sport as civilization-tech: competition framed as education, diplomacy, and a shared ritual for nations.
quote: The important thing in life is not triumph, but combat. The main thing is not to have won, but to have fought well.
fun-desc: He basically invented a recurring global festival where countries argue with stopwatch poetry instead of cannons.

name: Jean Reno
achievements: Key leading man in major French hits and global productions; iconic collaborations with Luc Besson.
legacy: The ‘quiet gravity’ archetype: making stillness charismatic, and understatement feel colossal.
quote: I'm a minimalist. I don't really need much to enjoy a good holiday - just my family and the bare essentials.
fun-desc: He can say almost nothing and somehow the whole scene listens harder.

name: Louis IX (Saint Louis)
achievements: Major Capetian king associated with justice reforms, royal authority, and crusading leadership.
legacy: The “just king” mythos: a political model where legitimacy is welded to morality and sacred symbolism.
quote: In prosperity, give thanks to God with humility and fear lest by pride you abuse God's benefits and so offend him.
fun-desc: He’s the rare medieval ruler remembered as both administrator and icon, like a crown with a conscience.

name: Hubert Lyautey
role: Marshal of France | Colonial Administrator (Resident-General in Morocco)
achievements: Key figure in establishing the French protectorate in Morocco; major military and administrative career.
legacy: A case study in “power + planning”: the empire-era belief that governance could be engineered like a city.
quote: The only excuse for colonization is the doctor.
fun-desc: He treated administration like architecture: plans, façades, and the conviction that order can be designed.

name: Emmanuel Joseph Sieyès (Abbé Sieyès)
achievements: Author of What is the Third Estate?; major revolutionary-era political thinker and actor.
legacy: The engineer of legitimacy: turning ‘the nation’ into a concept sharp enough to cut through an old regime.
quote: What is the Third Estate? All. What has happened so far in the political order? Nothing. What does he ask? To be something.
fun-desc: He wrote pamphlets that behaved like detonators: small object, enormous blast radius.
